page.title: 05BUILDINGS OF INTEREST cont.
page.content: {UPLOWMAN HOUSE} This is a large Georgian House.It was originally the Rectory.Above the stables at the back of the house was the old schoolroom. {CHIEFLOWMAN HOUSE The house was built of stone from the Westleigh quarries in front.At the back and side are the remains of the old Saxon house.Here the Lord of the Manor lived.At the back is the Ash House.Wood ash stored there,from the house fires and spread on the garden to lighten the heavy soil. {HIGHER CHIEFLOWMAN FARM} This is a typical Devon long farm house. {THE VILLAGE POST OFFICE} This was built in 1720.
